events.description: The Reserve Bank of India kept its repo rate at 5.25% in February 2026, after a 25-basis-point cut in December.

facts.fact_text: India's 10-year G-Sec yield rose to around 6.7%.

evidences.evidence_text: The yield on India’s 10-year G-Sec rose to around 6.7%, recovering from two-week lows, as tight domestic liquidity and global rate trends pushed investors to demand higher returns.

facts.fact_text: The Reserve Bank of India kept its repo rate at 5.25% in February 2026.

evidences.evidence_text: The Reserve Bank of India kept its repo rate at 5.25% in February 2026, after a 25-basis-point cut in December.

facts.fact_text: Indian lenders face a deposit shortfall.

evidences.evidence_text: Indian lenders face a deposit shortfall and are reluctant to buy government bonds, as RBI’s FX interventions and liquidity injections have drained rupee funds.

facts.fact_text: The 10-year–2-year US Treasury yield spread is nearing a four-year high.

evidences.evidence_text: Additional support came from US Treasury yields, with the 10-year–2-year spread nearing a four-year high amid expectations of Fed rate cuts and persistent concerns over inflation and the fiscal deficit.

evidence.evidence_text: The yield on India’s 10-year G-Sec rose to around 6.7%, recovering from two-week lows, as tight domestic liquidity and global rate trends pushed investors to demand higher returns.
The yield on India’s 10-year G-Sec rose to around 6.7%, recovering from two-week lows, as tight domestic liquidity and global rate trends pushed investors to demand higher returns.

links.source_ref: RBI’s FX interventions and liquidity injections

evidence.evidence_text: Indian lenders face a deposit shortfall and are reluctant to buy government bonds, as RBI’s FX interventions and liquidity injections have drained rupee funds.
Banks are seeking relief on LCR norms, HTM flexibility, and CRR adjustments, with limited market participation keeping yields elevated.

Additional support came from US Treasury yields, with the 10-year–2-year spread nearing a four-year high amid expectations of Fed rate cuts and persistent concerns over inflation and the fiscal deficit.
